title:
A fully nonlinear locally constrained curvature flow for capillary
  hypersurface
abstract:
In this article, we study a locally constrained fully nonlinear curvature
flow for convex capillary hypersurfaces in half-space. We prove that the flow
preserves the convexity, exists for all time, and converges smoothly to a
spherical cap. This can be viewed as the fully nonlinear counterpart of the
result in \cite{MWW}. As a byproduct, a high-order capillary isoperimetric
ratio (1.6) evolves monotonically along this flow, which yields a class of the
Alexandrov-Fenchel inequalities.
